definition: to go with the tide/to blindly follow the crowd/to follow the trend
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)

sentences.english: Don’t just be a follower who adapts his or her self to the conditions that already exist.
sentences.chinese: 不要只做一個跟風者去適應業已既定的環境。

sentences.english: Might these encourage others to follow suit?
sentences.chinese: 這會不會鼓勵別國的跟風？

sentences.english: They have simply followed each other in reporting an untruth.
sentences.chinese: 他們只是跟風撒播一件不真實的事情。

sentences.english: If someone has it, other people want it.
sentences.chinese: 有人有了某種東西，別人就跟風想得到。

sentences.english: And the snub undoubtedly creates a precedent other countries may follow.
sentences.chinese: 而這一冷遇無疑爲其他國家的跟風開創了先例。

sentences.english: The technology industry likes to sneer at Microsoft as a follower.
sentences.chinese: 信息產業似乎在嘲笑微軟是個跟風者。

sentences.english: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
sentences.chinese: 領袖和跟風者的區別就在於創新。
